alert.note: Alert for Eastern Loudoun; Fairfax; Prince William, Manassas, Manassas Park; Western Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued February 02 at 7:22AM EST until February 02 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility around one quarter mile with temperatures around 29 to 32 degrees. * WHERE...In Maryland, Frederick MD, Carroll, Northwest Montgomery, Central and Southeast Montgomery and Northwest Howard Counties. In Virginia, Prince William/Manassas/Manassas Park, Fairfax, Western Loudoun and Eastern Loudoun Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With temperatures near or below freezing, fog may cause icy spots on untreated surfaces. Temperatures will rise above freezing for most locations by 10 AM.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Loudoun; Fairfax; Prince William, Manassas, Manassas Park; Western Loudoun
